title: Transforming Scores
question_text: A set of scores is transformed by applying the following to each of the scores: $$\text{transformed score }= 2.6 \text{ (original score) }- 1.4$$ Which of the following statements is FALSE?

choices.text: The standard deviation of the transformed scores = 2.6 (standard deviation of the  original scores) − 1.4 = 2.6 (standard deviation of the  original scores) − 1.4
The IQR of the transformed scores = 2.6 (IQR of the original scores) = 2.6 (IQR of the original scores)
The Q3 of the transformed scores = 2.6 (Q3 original score) − 1.4 = 2.6 (Q3 original score) − 1.4
The mean of the transformed scores = 2.6 (mean of the original score) − 1.4 = 2.6 (mean of the original score) − 1.4
The median of the transformed scores = 2.6 (median of the original score) − 1.4 = 2.6 (median of the original score) − 1.4
